snippet: The deadline for people to sign up for health insurance won’t be extended, the secretary of health and human services said.
abstract: Health and Human Services Secretary Kathleen Sebelius testifies before the House Ways and Means Committee that the deadline for people to sign up for health insurance will not be extended and the requirement for most American to have coverage will not be delayed; declines to say whether the Obama administration is still committed to its original goal of enrolling seven million people in private coverage by March 31.
lead_paragraph: The deadline for people to sign up for health insurance won’t be extended, the secretary of health and human services said.

headline.main: Health Mandate Won’t Be Delayed, Sebelius Says
headline.print_headline: Health Mandate Won’t Be Delayed, Sebelius Says
